result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:29 PM Defendant Justin Levi Sexton in court.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Justin Levi Sexton.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Witt states they have stipulated to the DE being competent to continue with the court proceedings. The defendant waives his right to the preliminary hearing. Atty Witt states that they request to waive the preliminary hearing set for arraignment and proceed to a DA PTC. Court finds probable cause. Defendant bound over for trial. Atty Witt states that they waive formal reading of the information. Defendant enters a plea of Not Guilty to all three counts. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:30 AM Defendant Justin Levi Sexton in court.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Justin Levi Sexton.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. DAR reporter via zoom. Green County DAR used. Atty Witt states the defendant is meeting with   Doctor Marcus on 6/16/22 at 12:00PM. Was previously scheduled for Friday 6/10/22 but was postponed. Matter set over one month.
Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:59 PM Defendant Justin Levi Sexton in court.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Justin Levi Sexton.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties have received copies of the competency report. Attorney Witt requests a second opinion by Dr. Jeffrey Marcus. The State is not requesting the second opinion but has no objection. Attorney Witt to make arrangements with Dr. Marcus. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing on June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:41 AM Justin Levi Sexton, defendant appeared in Court via zoom with counsel Adam Thomas Witt via zoom.
Matt Lantta appeared as prosecuting attorney via zoom. Competency evaulation set over to 3/31/2022. Hearing set for 3-30-2022 taken off the calendar. Rescheduled to 05/18/2022 @ 2:45pm.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendants sister called to varify the new court date and time. Gave the Dr's office number to call she was going to see if she could help reschedule the appointment for him. He was not aware of an appointment. Clerk gave the zoom info to her she was going to help defendant with the zoom call.

Status conference on March 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Justin's Sister called to find out his correct date for Justin to appear - I gave her 3-30-22 at 1:30 PM and told her he needs to appear in person - then she wanted to know if he had a warrant out on him and I told her no.  She will let him know his court date.
Defendant no show

10:05 AM Justin Levi Sexton, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Adam Thomas Witt. Matt Lantta appeared as prosecuting attorney. Attorney Witt raising competency. The court finds probable cause. Court directs an outpatient evaluation for competency. Defendant seeking recusal of judges due to relation of staff involved. The court to have the district court administrator assign a new Judge. Bond continues. Matter set over 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
